page.title: 14Whiston Village
page.content: In the village of Whiston there are forty-six brick houses, which are mostly modern, and there are forty-three stone houses. Brook Hollow cottage, one of the oldest houses in the village, used to be the village shop but now it's a post office. There used to be a cafe near the public house which was the site of the blacksmith's forge which was closed in 1945. A main road passes through the village - the A52. Many lorries pass the school from local quarries scattering limestone and sand over the pavements, when they go too fast. As the village is built on high ground the winters are cold and it usually snows heavily, blocking roads. The one in six hill out of the Churnet valley is dangerous and often gets blocked. Sometimes lorries run out control.
